abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is highly
            satisfactory, and project sustainability is equally high.
            The lessons convey that the continuous coordination by the
            privatization agency's Project Coordination Unit (PCU)
            with stakeholders, greatly contributed to clarify the
            interdependence of all components, in meeting project
            objectives, and, the early engagement of a project
            management, and procurement advisor by the PCU, enabled
            sound management, and financial practices. Likewise, the
            close link, of the privatization agency with government
            authorities, enabled forecasting problems, which could thus
            be solved in a timely manner. The numerous supervision
            missions, provided not only, the support needed to execute
            the project as per loan covenants, but the flexibility to
            adjust during implementation, to changes in line with
            project objectives. Both the Bank, and the Borrower were
            sensitive of the complex socio-political environment of the
            country, which enabled the right dialogue among technical
            coordinators, to attain high commitment to project
            implementation. Cost savings from different components was
            instrumental for supporting the establishment of the first
            National Information Agency, and the network within the
            Ministry of Finance, to upgrade computerization. It is
            suggested that computer maintenance, and upgrading services
            be included under a follow-up operation.
